title: 'My husband was an angel - then he raped me'
description: Marital rape has long been a taboo issue in Egypt, but now victims are beginning to speak out.

title: Medics fear surge in winter viruses alongside Covid
description: A potential triple whammy of viruses prompts calls for more testing to reduce spread this autumn.

title: Should we trust big tech with our health data?
description: Our medical records are in demand by tech firms who want to use the data to help tackle illnesses.

title: Covid: Isolating children miss the last week of primary school
description: This Cheshire school's end-of-year play has gone ahead despite a child testing positive for Covid-19.

title: Czech women seek compensation for coerced sterilisations
description: Thousands of women were sterilised without their consent in former Czechoslovakia in the 1970s and 1980s.

title: Afghanistan: Reporting streets away from the Taliban in Kunduz province
description: The BBC's Yogita Limaye travels to Afghanistan's Kunduz province, most of which has fallen to the Taliban.

title: Olympic Games: 'Gang life nearly killed me - sprinting was my way out'
description: As Darren Campbell emerged as a talented teenage sprinter, he was leading a double life as a gang member. A twist of fate broke him free.

title: Lions players 'bullish' about Test series despite first defeat - is it false-confidence?
description: British and Irish Lions head coach Warren Gatland says his players are in "bullish" mood, but is it false confidence?

title: South Africa mother: Why I threw baby to strangers
description: The building was allegedly set on fire by looters amid an eruption of riots across South Africa.

title: PMQs: What did Boris Johnson say about the booing of England players?
description: Labour challenged the prime minister over his position on those who booed England when they "took the knee".

title: Most Covid rules set to be lifted in Wales on 7 August
description: Most Covid rules will be scrapped if coronavirus rates allow - but face mask laws will stay.

title: Online racists to be banned from football matches, vows Boris Johnson
description: The PM vows to change football banning orders - but Sir Keir Starmer says his promise "rings hollow".

title: Marcus Rashford mural messages of support to be preserved
description: Hundreds of notes were placed on the artwork which was defaced following England's final defeat.

title: Legacy plans enable NI 'to draw line under the Troubles'
description: Boris Johnson says a plan to address legacy matters will allow people in NI to "move forward".

title: Waterstones to encourage shoppers to wear masks in stores
description: Bookseller is one of the first major chains to state policy for shops, but its stance attracts a mixed response.

title: Euro 2020 final: Harry Maguire's father suffered two suspected broken ribs
description: Harry Maguire's father Alan suffered two suspected broken ribs before England's Euro 2020 final defeat by Italy, says the England defender.

title: 'Watching England at Wembley was unbelievable - I can't wait to see what Silverstone will be like'
description: W Series driver and BBC Sport columnist Jamie Chadwick has been gorging on sport this summer - now it's her turn to shine.

title: Price rises speed up again as economy unlocks
description: The inflation rate hit 2.5% in June, exceeding the Bank of England's target for a second month.

title: Conservative MP Steve Baker urges party to back players taking the knee
description: Steve Baker says Conservatives face a "wake-up call" over their attitude towards anti-racism protest.

title: North West England leads housing boom with prices up 15%
description: Official figures show property prices also rising rapidly in Scotland, Wales and the North East of England.

title: Gun resembling Lego toy sparks backlash in US
description: A US company is told to stop producing a customised firearm covered in what looks like Lego.

title: What more can be done to stop racist abuse online?
description: Abuse directed at England footballers has prompted calls for more action to tackle hate online.

title: England players return after self-isolation for T20 series
description: England name nine players forced to self-isolate during the recent one-day series with Pakistan in their T20 squad for the upcoming series between the countries.

title: Irons off the tee and 32,000 daily fans - what to expect as The Open returns
description: The Open Championship is back after a two-year wait but what can we expect from the field at Royal St George's?

title: The Papers: Kids 'defend Lions' and 'outrage' at foreign aid cut
description: Wednesday's papers report on the fallout after three England players were subjected to racist abuse.

title: Islamic State children in Syria face a lifetime in prison
description: A BBC investigation found that children, whose parents supported IS, are caught in a conveyor belt of incarceration.

title: UK public at risk from hostile state threats - MI5
description: The MI5 chief says people need to be as vigilant about covert state action as about terrorism.

title: How serious is the shortage of HGV drivers?
description: The industry says there's a shortage of 100,000 drivers but why is that and what is the likely impact?

title: How the Met Police deals with London's missing person reports
description: The missing persons specialists at the Met Police deal with thousands of cases a year. How do they prioritise them?

title: A pandemic constitutional in pictures
description: Paul Treacy looks back at the photographs he took recovering from "long Covid".
